moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: h5 is the theory move here
moves.13... Bxg4 14. fxg4 Nfxg4: 15. Bxg4 Nxg4 16. Nc6 and white has big advantage
moves.15... Nxe3 16. Qxe3 Qb6: ! this was the initial idea behind 11.Bxb5 (bad idea)
moves.17. Nd1 Nc4 18. Bxc4 Bxd4 19. Qg3: 19...Bxg1 20. Rxg1 Rc8 21. Bb3 etc and white are better, black has no plan, and no attacking chances
moves.19... Bxb2+ 20. Nxb2 Qxb2+ 21. Kd2 Qb4+: ? 21...Qd4 ! 22.Qd3 Qf2  with perpetual check (or 23.Kc1 Qf4  24. Kd1 d5! and white are in trouble follows Rb4 or Rd1). It's passable to play 22.Bd3 with complication after Rfc1
moves.22. Qc3 Rfc8: 22...Qc5 is not better after 23.Be2 black has nothing
moves.23. Qxb4 Rxb4 24. Bd3 h5: too slow Ra5 better but it won't save black.

opening: Sicilian (B76), dragon, Yugoslav attack, Rauser variation
